verses.verse: Lord<WH136>, you have been our living place<WH4583> in all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>.

Before the mountains<WH2022> were brought forth<WH3205>, or ever you had formed<WH2342> the earth<WH776> and the world<WH8398>, even from everlasting<WH5769> to<WH5704> everlasting<WH5769>, you are God<WH410>.
You turn<WH7725> man<WH582> to destruction<WH1793>; and say<WH559>, Return<WH7725>, you sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>.
For a thousand<WH505> years<WH8141> in your sight<WH5869> are but as<WH3117> yesterday<WH865> when it is past<WH5674>, and as a watch<WH821> in the night<WH3915>.
You carry them away as with a flood<WH2229>; they are as a sleep<WH8142>: in the morning<WH1242> they are like grass<WH2682> which grows up<WH2498>.
In the morning<WH1242> it flourishes<WH6692>, and grows up<WH2498>; in the evening<WH6153> it is cut down<WH4135>, and withers<WH3001>.
For we are consumed<WH3615> by your anger<WH639>, and by your wrath<WH2534> are we troubled<WH926>.
You have set<WH7896> our iniquities<WH5771> before you<WH5956>, our secret sins in the light<WH3974> of your favor<WH6440>.
For all our days<WH3117> are passed away<WH6437> in your wrath<WH5678>: we spend<WH3615> our years<WH8141> as a number that is told<WH1899>.

The days<WH3117> of our years<WH8141> are sixty<WH7657> years<WH8141> and ten<WH7657>; and if by reason of strength<WH1369> they be eighty<WH8084> years<WH8141>, yet is their strength<WH7296> labor<WH5999> and sorrow<WH205>; for it is soon<WH2440> cut off<WH1468>, and we fly away<WH5774>.
Who knows<WH3045> the power<WH5797> of your anger<WH639>? even according to your fear<WH3374>, so is your wrath<WH5678>.
So teach<WH3045> us to number<WH4487> our days<WH3117>, that we may apply<WH935> our hearts<WH3824> unto wisdom<WH2451>.
Return<WH7725>, O Lord<WH3068>, how long<WH5162>? and have pity concerning your servants<WH5650>.
O satisfy<WH7646> us early<WH1242> with your mercy<WH2617>; that we may rejoice<WH7442> and be glad<WH8055> all our days<WH3117>.
Make us glad<WH8055> according to the days<WH3117> where you have afflicted<WH6031> us<WH8141>, and the years where we have seen<WH7200> evil<WH7451>.
Let your work<WH6467> appear<WH7200> unto your servants<WH5650>, and your glory<WH1926> unto their sons<WH1121>.

And let the beauty<WH5278> of the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> be upon us<WH3559>: and establish you the work<WH4639> of our hands<WH3027> upon us<WH4639>; Yes, the work of our hands<WH3027> establish<WH3559>.
